mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: In setting Andre on his search for self, Mr. Rock has carved out a third way, in the process creating a black character who’s fully human and a comedy that’s wholly a blast.
Top Five is fully loaded. The laughs are earned, the intelligence never disappears, all the performers shine. But Rock is the diamond — raw, rough and rare.

Top Five is the funniest movie I've seen this year, and the calendar's running out. No matter whose movie Rock's resembles, it is completely his, and a brash start to being taken seriously as an artist.
Chris Rock couldn't have planned it this way, but his exuberant and wondrous comedy Top Five, opening at just the right time, is like an airdrop of candy over the city, if not the country.

Top Five is, above everything else, really entertaining. It is a successful sophisticated spin on Hollywood formula, and it feels like Chris Rock finally finding a filmmaking voice that is just as limber and funny and sharply satirical and angry and even romantic as Rock's stand-up.

It’s like watching a first-rate standup routine transformed into fiction, or in this case auto-fiction, as Rock has more on his mind than just making us laugh, offering up a witty celebrity satire that doubles as a love story set during one long and eventful New York City day.

As brilliantly funny as Chris Rock is, he's never been able to replicate the high-voltage danger and electricity of his stand-up act on the big screen. But in his latest film, the sharply satirical Top Five, he not only makes a case for why he should be a bona fide movie star, he also proves he's a writer-director to be reckoned with.
It avoids the trap of simply being a celebrity vehicle about celebrity, by displaying a surprising heart beneath its very funny surface.

The film feels freshly minted because the man who made it has such a lively mind and fearless style. At a time when all too many movies are selling bleakness and dysfunction, it also feels like a revenant from Hollywood’s golden age, when an entertainment’s highest function was to entertain.

Rock is enormously appealing here, balancing his patented comic abrasiveness with a real tenderness, the faint bewilderment of an ordinary man blindsided by his own success. And Dawson makes an excellent foil.

A truly refreshing break from the Hollywood humdrum, the film is a perfect vehicle for Rock's range of talents, giving him plenty of breathing space to launch into his trademark stand-up riffs while grounding him in a story as moving as it is funny.
With Top Five, Rock has finally made the transition to true movie stardom.
Top Five is Rock's best movie by a mile. It's authentically hilarious.

This is a smart, savvy film with sabre-sharp one-liners, a half-dozen terrific supporting turns, one of the best scores of the year, a winning romance and a heartfelt and authentic performance from Rock.
Rock's savage wit comes through in the wry screenplay, which is loaded with topicality as it pokes fun at subjects ranging from Tyler Perry movies to Angry Birds.
Funny, foul-mouthed and frighteningly on-the-money, Top Five is relentlessly amusing even while it’s super-indulgent and selfabsorbed. Rock on.
A merrily ferocious pop at the Hollywood bubble that balances sharp, acid laughs with a sweet, believable meet-cute. Top of the pack and Chris Rock’s best movie.

Top Five is not an op-ed. The movie probably makes its loudest statement about race simply by existing: an ambitious and personal film full of black stars, backed in part by black producers, written, directed by, and starring a hugely popular black artist.
Top Five is a funny movie, but Rock has his sights set higher than lowbrow, and for the most part, he succeeds.
A lost-artist comedy in the vein of Woody Allen’s Stardust Memories, but more deeply, a referendum on the dead-end choices Rock himself might be feeling.
It’s one of the most vibrant, sly romantic comedies this year.

Everywhere in America these days, people pay lip service to the idea of conducting open and honest conversations about race. Due to a fluke of timing and its entertaining quality, Top Five should help get the ball rolling.
Rock  – who also wrote and directed  – is very good as Andre, and the filmmaking is fine.

Most filmmakers barely know how to capitalize on Dawson’s talents other than to fill up the screen with her goddess-like beauty. But Rock treats her single mom who boasts a checkered romantic past along with strong opinions as an equal sparring partner.
Top Five finds Rock in an elevated form, at 49. Things change, sometimes for the better.
If there’s a surprise to Top Five, it’s the emotional undercurrent that Rock writes and Dawson brings out. What lingers hours later aren’t just the laughs but the people.
It’s a slap-happy movie and often scurrilously funny — the sound of a gifted comic mind finally finding its onscreen voice.
In Top Five, you sense Rock trying to load all these disparate talents onto a conventional romantic-comedy structure. It's a close call, but it holds.
The result is raunchy, energetic, sharp-eyed and a bit rambling.

Admittedly, Top Five suffers from its share of too-convenient contrivances and clunky passages... But Top Five is also buoyantly self- sustaining, thanks in part to Rock and Dawson’s easy, convincingly seductive chemistry and some genuinely hilarious surprises.
It’s a big leap forward for Rock as both an actor and a filmmaker, written and directed with the nervous, live-wire energy that has eluded his on-screen work for so long.
A disorganized, dawdling mess of a movie that is rarely anything less than charming.

The first half of the movie, which alternates between hilariously vulgar, gross gags and some electric improvs and riffs by Rock and his cast of all-stars, has the crackle and pop of a live performance — it energizes you.
If Top Five doesn’t go deep, though, it is intermittently very funny.

Rock is more a genial presence here than an actor playing an addict tested by a bad day. He never lets us see the strain that could make him fall off the wagon. He scores laughs, but generously leaves the outrageous stuff to his legion of supporting players.
For an ostensibly soul-deep movie like this to work, we need more than smirks and scowls.
Top Five is that movie precisely so good and yet still so flawed that you can watch greatness slip out of its ambitious but awkward reach right in front of your eyes.

mc_user_reviews.text: Decent movie, worth a few laughs. Story was a bit bland, but cameos made up for it.

By far Chris Rock's most well made film.  Rock has seemed to learn a lot from some of his past work.  This film is funny, well paced, and you care about Rock's character.  Not a game changer but Chris Rock deserves real credit.  B+

Top Five for me is Chris Rock's best film in years. chris has written a script that is both funny and insightful mocking so many aspects of fame and the ensemble cast really sells it with some excellent performances. it isn't a straight up comedy and anyone who goes into the film may be disappointed and it's better to approach it as a fly on the wall drama with funny moments.
This was the worst movie ever.  There were good actor and actresses that lower than standards to be in this movie.  Was sick ok the "N" word wasn't funny in the least bit.

A lot of moments where you feel like there is real danger, when not everything is funny when it should be......what did the room smell like...... tracy morgan mentions 6th man when i feel like he was in 6th man...I can't go on.....40 minutes of this movie is so bad and so is my life.....

Its a feel good movie. Some people might find it stupid and unfunny. To be honest the movie is hilarious. With some disturbing moments like the scene where the woman put her finger inside a mans **** I found it disturbing but hilarious. Definitely worth a watch

This is an interesting movie, tries something different, hit some balls, missed others but at the end is a movie worth watching. The plot is not superb but manages to keep you engaged in the film, you probably leave the film thinking about the moments you liked but end up forgetting about the film in a couple days.
Even the laziest amount of work did to complete Top Five seriously made this movie look like a blast from a rocket and it's to the past. Enjoy this movie over and over again if you want to.
Top Five reasons to see the new Chris Rock movie "Top Five":

The interviewer/star relationship seemed contrived from  the start, and the NYT journalist with "a past" wasn't convincing. There were some laughs, some from sexual situations  that may be funnier if you have a low laugh threshold, but overall not a big laugh riot, and not a compelling story. I like Chris Rock, but I'd say save your box office $ and see it later on the cheap.

Before I describe my thoughts of Top Five, I have to state my expectations.  I was expecting a raunchy comedy, unashamed of it thirst for laughter and comically respectful in its view of the black community; although free from strict restrictions to realism.  With that genre in mind I found Top Five to be a great movie.  The comedy is top notch (I'm even smiling as I think of some of the scenes now) and it's success at blending so many cameos by top comedians was a true treat for the audience.  I don't give it an excellent rating because (1) Chris Rock can't act (2) My excellent rating is reserved for "smart" not "raunchy" comedy and (3) the decision not to play out the ending may be creative to some but I found that to be lazy.  But other than those things I thought this movie was great and I'm looking forward to seeing it again.  But, for some, the sex scenes can be disgusting and the language could be offensive.  I found them to be funny but I can understand and appreciate someone who disagrees.  This isn't a movie I'd be comfortable viewing with my mother and I'm 45 years old :-)

The commercials, trailers and even seeing Chris Rock on talk shows make it seem like it's a fast paced, joke fest. it's not. While it has runs of fast paced jokes, the majority of the movie is a simple romance comedy. If you don't guess the outcome of the movie before it's half over, then you've never seen a predictable rom-com.

I will never see a Chris Rock film ever again. Cedric the ET'er and Tracy Morgan were the funniest things. They are 5 minutes of the film. Long gaps between laughs. Everything happens in 1 day? Totally stupid ending. I thought this was it, totally disappointing.
great movie. chris rock and rosario dawson have great chemistry. really funny script, kept me engaged throughout the film. not a perfect film, but one of the most entertaining this year.

Do you enjoy mediocre racist humor, tasteless sex scenes, and long stretches where nothing happens? Then, by all means, go see Top Five.  However, if you have any actual taste, then avoid this movie like the plague. I went to see this with a few buddies, expecting to get at least a few chuckles, but after about an hour of stale jokes, we had to walk out, For many parts, there isn't even anything that resembles a joke. Not to mention the disgusting sex scenes that have no comedic value and drag on much longer than they should. I have no idea why this movie is being praised so much, probably because the "progressive" Rock "tackles" issues about race (in a way that would get a white actor kicked out of the film industry if they tried the same thing), but it isn't worth an instant of your time, not even a rental.

You can wait to see this movie on DVD.  Some laughs.   Fine with the heterosexual ranchiness (funny and got the point across).  The use of the N word (cringe worthy - really unnecessary) the first 30 minutes (and then none after that) demonstrates the lack of substance in this movie and writing.  Chris Rock doesn't pick on people in the audience for his standup - why the use of the N word?  He himself uses the word to describe black people.  I'm paying to be insulted?  There was more N word than other foul language by many of the comedians.  Geez whiz!  Good writing allows you to stay out of the sewer.  Storyline reminded of a previous Rock movie with Kerry Washington and Gina Torres.  Many placements of comedians with many laughs but again Rock misses the connection between story lines.  Waiting for another standup movie from Chris Rock once I find out I won't be insulted.  Stick to standup Chris.  Signed James Nielsen.  (BTW - after the outstanding review for American Hustle everywhere online it seems now most critics are getting paid so watch for real reviews - not the ones by paid critcs)

A few laughs but hard to separate them from all the vulgarity that is prolific in this movie.  It was also hard to concentrate on the ensuing love story in development without have those gross images of unnecessary sex scenes, nudity and consistent cussing in the movie.  I would not even have rented the DVD!  Can I have my money back?
We walked out after 1/2 hour of total boredom. It is amazing that anyone would find this movie funny. If you really want to waste time and money, this is the flick to see.
A Must See! Not just hilarious, but a great film overall! Hopefully this becomes a box office smash because it deserves it! This is a really great film, and almost anyone can enjoy it!

I was a bit disappointed by this movie. It was not what I thought it was going to be and didn’t really portray the previews. There was too many long sex scenes and naked women and there was a lot of long boring dull moments. A lot of discrimination towards white people which gets annoying in some urban movies and that about sums it up. There was about 5 funny parts of the movie

User reviews are right on and say it quite eloquently.  Critic reviews are disappointing at best and are pandering and/or afraid to say the truth.  Let's be brutally frank and open up the discussion.  If a white man wrote this movie and stereotyped the way Rock did, he would be blasted.  Deadbeat dad; money hungry, star seeking, empty headed ho for a fiance; jewish friends who literally talk and throw money at strippers;  (Seinfeld shows true arrogant, self absorbed, narcissistic self); ghetto acting friends stuffed into the projects filled with fat wives, kids running around and more deadbeat dads drinking in the middle of the afternoon expounding on their talents are a few of the stereotypes but there are too many to mention all.  Apparently  it is OK if Rock is doing it,  its not stereotyping, its keeping it real.  To add insult to injury, the audience is supposed to believe that Rock, in the course of a day, bears his soul to an interviewer (who yes is an alcoholic too) and in a faux Cinderella moment runs back to her at the end of a day with a Satin shoe to seal the deal.  The crap the audience has to sit through to get to this fairy tale ending is outrageous, but not funny. There is  an orgy with two hookers, Cedric and Rock himself, complete with visuals and sound effects,   It is not pretty and pointless.  Rock, like his comedian friends is completely self absorbed and is affronted that his movie release about Hatian rebels is not taken seriously.  I guess this is a parody on  the idea that black entertainers need to be making a political statement to appease their own.  Anyway, it is a sham of a movie that seemed carelessly thrown together.  It is sad that in this day and age, we still need this kind of "in your face" insult of a movie to get a point across.  It is true that the black voice is missing.  However, if Shondra Rimes can do it, so can a person of Chris Rock's stature and talent.  I felt cheated at the end of this movie.  Chris, it was a cheap trick. I expected a lot more.

Just to give you some background - I have not walked out of a movie in probably 7 or 8 years, and I think Chris Rock is probably the greatest stand up comedian of all time.  That being said, this is one of the most god awful movies I have ever seen and I did in fact walk out of the movie after about 1 hour 30min or so, I just couldn't stay any longer.  The fact that this movie got great reviews once again shows how unbelievably low our standards for a good comedic movie have become.
This was one of the worse movies ive ever seen. Not a laugh to be found.

We walked out after about thirty minutes. It was not funny. We could barely understand some of the actors. Maybe English subtitles would have helped. We did get a refund from the theater. When we told the manager that we though Top Five was awful, he indicated that he was not surprised that we left and asked for a refund as when he previewed it, he gave up well before it was over.

Chris Rock wrote/directed/stars in this examination of a popular movie comic who attempts to restructure his career as a serious director. The film is structured around a discussion/interview with a New York Times reporter (Rosario Dawson), as he goes thru the day promoting his film's opening (and runs into a variety of entertaining cameos). Most of the comedy comes from Rock's signature irreverent insights, even when they come out of the other actors' mouths. Much of it is amusing and sometimes funny. Rock's performance and his direction have a robust energy, but the film is more a small personal project than a riotous big-screen comedy.

My enthusiasm for Chris Rock's stand-up did not survive his transition to filmmaker.  I usually need a few dramatic events to drag me along on a character's journey, but nothing happens in this movie for an hour!  The only surprise was that "Top Five" wasn't funny either. So what's the idea behind it all?  An interview on a walking tour of Manhattan? Seriously?

If this movie, as a whole, was as good as the last 45 minutes... this would be one of the greatest comedies of all time. Three laugh out loud scenes that got funnier as the movie went on. Rosario Dawson is absolutely magnetic in her role and as far as I'm concerned, she carried this film. Gabrielle Union's penultimate scene is the BEST she's ever acted in anything. CR is getting better as an actor, but I don't think he showed his true chops until the last third of the flick. He still has a problem breaking down the 4th wall, but he is really trying... I'm going to leave you with one word, three letters: DMX. That is all. Good job, Chris...

Top Five was really funny! Chris Rock was brilliant and his comedy was brilliant as usual. But the star of this film is how Rock makes a really great Rom Com and that's rare because nowdays they are just cashins, but Rock respects this theme and makes a fun movie out of it! Nicely done!
Oh my god, where to begin. Chris Rock has been funny since day one. He is hilarious as hell. Multiple hilarious moments in the movie, if you guys hadn't seen the movie yet, go see it. It's so funny.
Chris Rock taking on the directors chair... should be interesting.

Just a bad movie about a bad movie. This is another black movie, representing the black perspective toward comedy and sex. Top Five is not funny or serious or real. Usually I go with the critics, but on this one they got it way wrong.

Top Five is good. It is funny, dramatic, and has a relatable lead. The film is an interesting study of the life that a celebrity can and has faced. While the film has some really funny scenes don’t go into this film expecting an all out comedy. This more of a dramedy being both a comedy and drama, although for me it was a bit more of a drama. If you go in with that in mind you will enjoy this film. Its not going to be in the Top 5 films of the year, I doubt I’ll rewatch it again, and there is a chance I might not remember this film in a while but for what it was it was good and worth checking out.
I really wanted to like this movie. I laughed twice the entire movie. Put it this way... I have laughed more watching a Rob Schneider movie.

This is a movie about Chris' Rock's point of view in 2014. The problem is NOBODY can relate to Chris Rock's point of view. Unless you are a rich, black, celebrity who is too smart for stupid people and too unpretentious for smart people... you will find yourself unable to relate.

Can't say this was hallarious, but worth a few chuckles. Further, it was better than I thought it would be. There are ALOT of people making appearances in this flick, which add to the interest. The sound track was dope and I liked the flashbaacks which reminded me of some good times. . But I feel the movie played about 30 minutes too long. My top five: 1.  Jay  2. M  3. Tribe Called Quest 4. Gang Starr 5. Talib Kweli DONE!

Top Five is a fantastically funny and authentic film brought forth by Chris Rock who really captures what makes his comedy style work and puts it into a film. The film is well-written and well-directed by Rock who's film provides an authentic, touching, and amusing, look at stardom and the Hollywood star machine. Fast paced and funny throughout, Rock takes various approaches in this day in the life look at falling comedy superstar Andre Allen who has struggled with alcoholism in the past, as well as various other personal struggles. The film is casually honest, which is an approach I very much like. You see Rock's character do various things that show how hard it to be famous, yet the film never makes too big of a deal about it. In this way, for a comedy, the film really does not hold your hand and does not dumb itself down for its audience. Instead, the film wants rigorous honesty from its characters and is not afraid to show it to you, if you are willing to go along with them. A funny, honest, and at times moving film, Top Five is smart, subtle, and believable comedy.

Brilliant look at the trappings of celebrity and where happiness is actually found amid the fame and frenzy. Even though this role is obviously tailor-made for him, he still does an excellent job of portraying the conflicted ideas that come with success and expectation. Lacked a touch of depth as far as plot, but other than that was a great look at the pressure and distraction people in his business face.
When he was looking for a turnaround in his career, his life turned around.
Can i Please have my two hours back?  I Cannot for the life of me understand what all the hype was about.  This was a mediocre movie, with few laughs, very little chemistry between the leads.

In my opinion, it's not quite as funny or amazing as the rave reviews might have you believe. It is however Chris Rock's best film to date by a longshot. Rock gives an often times funny and honest performance as a comedy star trying to make it big as a dramatic actor all while under heavy press due to an upcoming wedding. Rosario Dawson also gives one of her best and most honest performances to date as the reporter assigned to interview him. Overall, while I did wish I could 've gotten a few more laughs out of the film, it was still undeniably entertaining and it also felt like one of those rare comedies nowadays that has a little heart to it compared to most comedies that are made purely to be silly and gross.

This movie is fantastic, I don't see how it is possible to not laugh all the way through this.  It isn't like Will Ferrell type funny, it was more like a Chris Rock stand up comedy show turned into a movie.  If you don't find this movie funny then your sense of humor is lacking.

Chris Rock showed that he was the complete package with this movie. He wrote directed and starred in Top Five. The film really captures what is like to be famous and adds a little humor to it. Both Rock and co-star Rosario Dawson were great and there are a lot of other really funny character that we will recognize throughout the movie like Tracy Morgan and Kevin Hart. We also get some really funny cameo appearances that I will no spoil. Top Five is not the funniest movie I ever watched nut its composition is original and it is just a down right good film even there was no humour. I would really enjoy another film with Chris Rock at the helm again.

Top Five is Chris Rock's first film in a few years and he is the Writer and Director of the film as well. You can fell when watching the film that Chris really cared about the Subjects/Themes covered and wanted to get his message threw to people. Top Five follows Chris Rock playing a character extremely similar to himself who's stuck dealing with people wanting to see him play the same rolls in movies over and over(Sound familiar?), but Chris wants to move forward onto bigger things in his career.The film also touches on dysfunctional Hollywood couples and Critics/Reporters that will say truly horrible things to get a story. Those darker themes aside this film was hilarious, Chris Rock and the rest of the casts chemistry was pronominal and at points it doesn't even feel like they are acting for a camera but just hanging out like old times. The humor isn't for everyone, if your not well versed in Classic Hip-Hop jokes may slip pasted you.
"Top Five" 10 Scale Rating: 7.5 (Very Good) ...

Hands down the smartest comedy I saw this year. I am not terribly amused by 90 minute dick and fart joke extravaganzas, so if that is your jam, this movie is not for you. (I will add that there is a very funny fart joke scene.) Though this is wholly original, it strongly references both Annie Hall and Sullivan's Travels and those are some pretty good inspirations to work from.

It's probably a good idea to avoid hyperbole when reviewing a movie for the first time, but here goes anyway. Top Five is well written, smart, very funny, and performed brilliantly. It's poignant, risky, risque, crude, and sensitive to it's material while completely disregarding viewer sensibility. So gentlemen, don't bring a date until you screen it yourself! But do a friend a favor, and bring a buddy. I'm going to now, because I have to see it again. I haven't laughed as hard or been this surprised by a film in a very long time. I had been wondering why I didn't know what my favorite movie of the 2014 was, and now I know. It was because I hadn't seen Chris Rock kill it with this one.
It's a great entertaining movie, of course not perfect, it also has great cameos and pop culture references, which improves the movie if you actually get them.

Of course this is a Woody Allen movie made by Chris Rock. What's great is that Woody hasn't made a Woody Allen movie this good in a decade. Here, Rock opens up honestly about a number of issues of particular importance to comedians, African American members of the entertainment industry, and the exploitative nature of reality TV. Some will love this just to see Jerry Seinfeld "make it rain" or Adam Sandler take a cheap shot by the main character's fiancee, but the strength of this film is in its comedic sadness.
It's a really good movie. Really funny and refreshing! Great acting, great cast, great job!

I almost dismissed the movie as stupid  after the firts five minutes. I'm so glad I didn't quit. Only Chris Rock can bring laugh out loud homour into raunchy borderline offensive sex scenes. Chris Rock and Dawson could have easily carried the movie on their own with just the hilarious flashbacks. I did not care for the first scene with Tracy and that whole bunch it just slowed things down. I give it an 8 because the ending was just too abrupt.

This movie is awesome. It is funny and awesome and worth your money.This movie made chris rock career better. The only problem I have with this movie is that kevin hart is only in one scene. But I give this movie a 9.2/10
